Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement
This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Sudan, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Are you ready to join a team of marketing and tech-savvy music lovers and witness your career take off as you thrive in a setting like no other?
The ideal candidate is a smart data-driven individual passionate about creating scalable digital advertising campaigns, tracking and analyzing data to determine KPIs, adjusting strategy in real-time to optimize results and spending most of his/her day between Tableau, Google and a spreadsheet in order to will help us truly scale our user acquisition efforts via all available channels!
We are currently seeking for a Marketing Data Analyst to join our Marketing team. This position reports to the Head of Product.
What you’ll do
Construct and maintain dashboards that allow users to understand performance compared to internal benchmarks and to generate insight
Gather and evaluate data, measure product performance, notice trends
Transform quantitative output into actionable, realistic marketing tactics
Identify and extract relevant performance analysis data
Present data, with analytics-based conclusions, to managers for assessment
Analyze financial and marketing metrics on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis
Collaborate with BI teams to understand data structure to measure customer engagement
Proactively alert management to operational issues (i.e. adverse changes in revenues, significant sales variances, adverse ratings and reviews)
Assist with research and launch of new products
Conduct on-going surveys on listenership, products, concepts and brand awareness
What we are looking for
Minimum 3 to 5 years of relevant experience
Expert Excel and PowerPoint skills, ability to take and combine multiple data sources and present insights
Experience with business intelligence and data warehouse solutions, ideally Tableau, Adobe Analytics, SQL or other related programs
Considerable knowledge of analytics tracking tools including Apps Flyer, Tableau, Segment, Mix panel
Ability to manipulate and combine multiple data sources and present insights simply and effectively that drive business decisions at all levels of the organization
Strong quantitative skills, experience utilizing scientific analytics methods, qualitative methods, and quantitative analysis techniques, as well as predictive modeling
Ability to work independently and prioritize work assignments, based on changing business needs
Strong written and verbal communication skills in French & English
What you are good at
Working under pressure within tight deadlines
Analyzing and being detail oriented
Presenting complex and somewhat technical information in a simple and effective manner
Organization and planning
Teamwork
Benefits
Share purchase plan (with a contribution from Stingray);
Breakfasts and snacks offered every day;
On-site cafeteria offering lunches at a very reasonable price;
Generous contribution by Stingray to the CDM GYM fees;
On-site free yoga lessons offered twice a week;
And much more!
Montreal-based Stingray Group is a leading music, media and technology company with over 1,200 employees worldwide. Stingray is a premium provider of curated direct-to-consumer and B2B (business to business) services, including audio television channels, more than 100 radio stations, subscriptions content, 4K UHD television channels, karaoke products, digital signage, in-store music and music apps, which have been downloaded over 150 million times. Stingray reaches 400 million subscribers (or users) in 156 countries.
Our offices are located in the Old Port of Montreal just minutes from the Lachine Canal bike path, a prime location for picnics or a jogging at lunch time. We are a young, energetic company committed to the well-being of our employees and who ensures it through benefits such as breakfasts, snacks, coffee for all tastes, free treats and 5@7 Fridays. We also have access to virtual health care! What else to say?
If you are looking for an exceptional workplace and have what it takes to fill this role, please send us your resume at jobsmarketing@stingray.com
Not the job for you? Check out our Careers page to consult other available positions and learn more about Stingray. We’re always on the lookout for new talent.
Stingray supports the principles of Employment Equity and is committed to ensuring our workforce is representative of the communities we serve and in which we operate. Women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and visible minorities are encouraged to apply and to self-identify so we can work towards full representation of those groups within our company.

We currently have a Temporary Full Time opportunity for a Data Analyst (Coder) in the Decision Support Department at our Bayview Campus.
Summary of Duties
Perform quality control processes on Activity Level Reporting (ALR) data to ensure quality and integrity of data submitted to Health Ontario (CCO)

Participating in testing of software applications as a result of system upgrades, software fixes and enhancements.
Other duties as assigned by the management team
Qualifications/Skills
Undergraduate Degree from a Health Sciences Program
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Strong technical and analytical aptitude
Ability to problem solve
Able to organize, plan and prioritize work with time constraints and strict deadlines
Minimum of two (2) years experience in a health care setting required.
Proven ability to develop and generate statistical/business reports using SQL, SAP Crystal Reports, PowerBI
Established proficiency in computer software applications (e.g. MSOffice, Visio and MS Projects)
Qualified candidates are invited to submit their cover letter and resume (in one document) quoting 201858 to:
Human Resources
Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter.
Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre is strongly committed to inclusion and diversity within its community and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: visible minorities, all religions and ethnicities, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ persons, and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.

Description:
Position: Junior Urban Assessment and Remediation Professional
Millennium EMS Solutions Ltd. (MEMS) is looking for an assessment and remediation professional to join our Assessment and Risk team to work on brownfield, industrial and/or commercial projects, primarily in urban environments. A minimum of 1 to 3 years of experience directly related to Phase I, Phase II support, and field sampling for soil, surface water, and groundwater, preferably in a consulting environment. The candidate’s experience must include coordinating and executing Phase 1 ESAs, Phase 2 ESAs and remediation projects within an urban setting. Knowledge and experience with relevant provincial and federal legislation and familiarity with the environmental site assessment process are assets. Preference will be given to candidates capable of completing fieldwork, strong writing and interpersonal skills, organizational abilities and technical competency. The successful candidate must be self-motivated with a strong work ethic and work effectively in a multi-disciplinary setting. MEMS presents opportunities to be crossed trained in other MEMS technical disciplines and provides mentoring in applying Tier 2 guidelines and site-specific risk assessments. The successful applicant will need to hold a valid, non-GDL Class 5 Drivers license and must be able to meet the requirements of site access as dictated by our clients, which may include pre-access drug and fitness testing. The successful applicant must also be a member or eligible for membership in a relevant professional organization
Reports to: Environmental Scientist
Based at: Calgary, Alberta
Job Purpose: The position requires a combination of office and fieldwork (40/60 split) in a consultancy environment. This position is available immediately, and duties include the following responsibilities:
Provide field support for Phase 1 ESAs for commercial and industrial properties.
File compilation, organization of field data, interpretation of laboratory results and report writing.
Ability to work independently or in a team setting and the ability to make responsible decisions with the support and mentoring of senior staff; and
Communicate effectively with clients and internal personnel as required.
Other duties assigned.
Millennium EMS Solutions Ltd. (MEMS) is a dynamic environmental consulting company offering outstanding opportunities and long term career advancement. Currently, MEMS employs over 130 employees in various disciplines including, hydrogeologists, engineers, soil scientists, foresters, vegetation ecologists, auditors, biologists, air quality experts, regulatory analysts and reclamation specialists. MEMS utilizes an integrated approach that emphasizes cross-training disciplines to improve data collection and assessment efficiencies and provides MEMS professionals with enhanced technical skills. See www.mems.ca for more information about Millennium.
MEMS offers an excellent benefits program, extra time banking and a performance bonus program. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:
Dental care
RRSP match
Vision care
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Experience:
field sampling for soil, surface water, and groundwater: 1 year (Required)
Phase I, Phase II support: 1 year (Required)
brownfield, industrial or commercial projects: 1 year (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (Preferred)
Work remotely:
No
Position: Junior Urban Assessment and Remediation Professional

Description:
Isthmus - Ottawa office

Are you looking to work smarter not harder' Do you want to join a team that will push you to try and be better each day while it also pushes its self to grow' Then we might be the right fit for you.

Under the supervision of the Senior WCB Analyst and working closely with the Account Management team and the Claims Teams, the applicant will conduct a financial reviews of our clients WCB insurance accounts, claims cost projections and all other related analysis. Furthermore – the analyst will be responsible for both the complete accuracy of their projections.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Review WCB monthly cost statements for financial quality control of claims
Conduct account/claim projections relating to client’s national accounts
Calculate projected claim costs for individual claims
Evaluate risk and exposure for clients and prepare presentations for clients and senior management
Review and analyze statistical data surrounding workplace injuries
Effectively communicate your findings both internally and externally in a transparent manner
REQUIREMENTS
Excellent ability to work both independently, and within a team to achieve the best results for our clients
Strong mathematical skills
Excellent ability to read and analyze financial documents
Excellent written and oral skills in English
Excellent attention to detail
Ability to manage multiple priorities and tight deadlines

At Golder, we thrive on challenges.


Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.

Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?

Golder has a new opportunity for a Junior Environmental Scientist to join our Environmental Sciences team on a full-time basis based in Vancouver.

The successful candidate will be expected to learn from and work cooperatively with various members of the group and will have the opportunity to assume increasing autonomy and responsibilities over time. Your day to day activities include assisting with human health and ecological risk assessments, environmental impact assessment and environmental effects monitoring projects for a wide range of clients throughout Western Canada.

An overview of your role will include:
Data entry and screening
Data interpretation including statistical analysis and preparing written and graphical material for reports and presentations
Conducting field work in accordance with safe work procedures and quality assurance/quality control measures applicable to the task
Conducting literature reviews on a range of topics related to human health toxicology and ecotoxicology
Providing report summaries and/or critical analysis of reports
Assisting with report and proposal preparation
Your background will include:
A Master’s degree in Toxicology, Public Health, Resource Management, Applied Biology or related field is preferred. A Bachelor’s degree with appropriate course work or co-op experience would also be considered
Previous work experience in a relevant consulting, industry or government position is preferred but is not mandatory
Familiarity with environmental sampling methods
Knowledge of Canadian regulatory guidance related to environmental impact assessment, aquatic environmental monitoring and environmental effects monitoring
Good attention to detail
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work in a team environment
Strong interpersonal, communication, and innovative thinking skills are essential
Your benefits at Golder will include:
Competitive benefits and remuneration packages
Employee owned structure - own the business, own the result
Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment
Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects
On the job training, mentoring and coaching
Global projects and travel opportunities
One of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 13 consecutive years

Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 30 countries, Golder’s 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.

Golder is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. As such, Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities, upon request.

To learn more about our company and culture click here to view The Promise of Goldervideo.

Summary of Duties, but not limited to:
Responsible for releasing personal health information (PHI) to authorized recipients in accordance with policies/procedures, the Personal Health Information Protection Act (PHIPA) and other relevant provincial/federal legislation(s)
Ensures security and confidentiality of PHI from unauthorized requestors
Interacts extensively with external agencies, law offices, other hospitals, health care agencies, patients and their families
Co-ordinates requests for patient access to their own health information
Collects payment for release of information as per WCH’s ROI fee schedule
Monitoring and ensuring image stations are properly prepared and maintained for image capture and viewing.
Accountable for productivity and accuracy of all ROI requests
Responsible for promoting confidentiality & privacy awareness
Represent the hospital in court when required by a subpoena as it relates to patient health records
Exercises good judgment and resolves issues related to ROI
Builds relationships with both our internal and external customers
As a role model and champion you will work to identify and integrate safe, best practices into daily activities to foster the delivery of safe and exemplary care.

The responsibilities described above are representative and are not to be construed as all-inclusive.
Company Bio
About Women’s College Hospital
Women’s College Hospital (WCH) is Canada’s leading independent, academic, ambulatory care hospital with a primary focus on the health of women. Founded in 1883 by Dr. Emily Stowe – a suffragist and the first Canadian woman licensed to practice medicine in Canada – our Hospital has earned its distinguished reputation through hard work, commitment, and a pioneering spirit of innovation.

Today, our ongoing achievements and our dedication to improving healthcare are building on that admirable legacy of leading-edge care and unparalleled caring. WCH opened the Hospital of the Future – a new, $555 million, state-of-the-art fully ambulatory facility – in fall 2015.

The opening of our new facility amplified our position as one of the most ground-breaking institutions in the world focused on advancing the health of women and pioneering health system solutions that benefit all people.

WCH is home to one of the only hospital-based research institutes in the world focused on the health of women, and we are fully affiliated with the University of Toronto as one of Canada’s leading teaching hospitals.

Job Description
Qualifications
Graduate of an approved Health Information Management program required
Current active member in good standing with the Canadian Health Information Management Association (CHIMA) required
Two (2) years previous experience in a hospital health records environment required
Maintains a thorough knowledge of key legislation pertaining to release of personal health information (Personal Health Information Protection Act, Public Hospitals Act, Mental Health Act, Coroner’s Act, Vital Statistics Act, Consent to Treatment Act). Proven ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment both independently and within a team, exercising sound judgment
Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills
Excellent computer skills with working knowledge of MS Office Suite and Med2020 preferred
Experience with release of information preferred
Customer service oriented with professional behavior and communication that meets the standards of the professional regulatory college or association, as applicable, and the standards of Women’s College Hospital.
Professional behavior and communication that meets the standards of the professional regulatory college or association, as applicable, and the standards of Women’s College Hospital
This position plays a critical role in acting as an advocate for safety and will demonstrate principles, practices and processes that will optimize a safe environment for all
Closing Statement
Women's College Hospital is a fully affiliated teaching hospital of the University of Toronto and is committed to fairness and equity in employment and our recruitment and selection practices. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, people with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups, members of racialized groups, women and any others who may contribute to the further diversification of our Hospital community. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process as required under our Access for People with Disabilities policy. Applicants need to make their requirements known in advance.

Description:
Data Analyst
On behalf of our client, Procom is seeking a Data Analyst for a 12 month contract in Calgary, AB.
Data Analyst Job Details
The mission of the Unify Transformational program is to design common enterprise-wide business processes, data and systems within common enterprise platforms (Oracle and Maximo) to simplify, standardize and automate across finance, supply chain, and asset & work management.
The Data Analyst works provides expertise and support to the Finance workstream data teams in data quality, conversion and associated issue resolution.
Additionally, the Data Analyst will assist with tracking and reporting progress throughout test data conversions and final cutovers. And finally, the Data Analyst will support the Internal Controls team document control points in business processes.
Data Analyst Responsibilities
Support execution of data readiness scope and deliverables to meet program timelines and key dates
Provide support to data functional teams and external teams for data profiling, collection, cleansing and validation
Track data readiness metrics
Support planning and communication of the data work within the Finance workstreams
Support integration and coordination of team members working on data activities
Identify data readiness issues and challenges, plan and execute resolution and escalate as required
Facilitate and drive resolution of issues within and across teams with respect to requirements and processes
Support execution of data conversion processes across entire data lifecycle to meet program timelines and key dates, including cutovers
Identify data readiness opportunities for optimization and execution in order to maximize efficiencies
Support inputs into project status to leadership and stakeholders
Support and provide guidance to data readiness team members
Data Analyst Mandatory Skills
Related university degree in Business or Technology
Experience with Oracle ERP Financials
Experience with large scale, complex project go-lives (i.e. cutovers)
4-10 years of directly related experience with data transformation on large enterprise programs
Experience with data standards and data quality reporting
Able to identify risks and issues and recommend actions to remedy and escalate when necessary
Proven interpersonal, communication and influence skills applied with technical and functional personnel
Willing to get into the details to help progress the work and report status
Able to understand the enterprise wide and Business Unit specific requirements
Proficient with MS Excel, PowerPoint and Project
Preferred:
Industry experience in energy storage and distribution
Experience with Oracle HFM Consolidations, EPBCS Planning, ECMCS Data Management
Experience with Internal Controls and mapping to business processes
Experience with data sustainment and enterprise data governance
Data Analyst Location
Calgary, AB.
Data Analyst Assignment Length
12 months

CSR Data Analyst - Saskatoon, SK (2 Year Term)
Responsibilities include:
· Maintain the inter-departmental stakeholder interaction database that is easily accessible for various report requirements on projects, activities; spend data for northern business, donations, employment, etc.
· Work with multiple departments to ensure that current reporting requirements (ex. Surface Lease Report, Community Investment) are met and other program activities are recorded to provide input into Orano’s reporting requirements (i.e. annual Sustainability Report, CSR Report, Socio-economic Report, etc.)

· Maintain the CSR department paper and electronic records
· Embrace and support Operational Excellence efforts and OE Culture
· Comply with all Orano health, safety and environmental policies, practices and procedures
· Promote and adhere to Orano Canada’s values: Customer Satisfaction, Continuous Improvement, Respect and People Development, Cohesion and Team Spirit, and Exemplarity, Integrity, Responsibility
Skills and Qualifications for the position include:
· Bachelor of Commerce or Business Management or post-secondary education related to Education, Legal, Environment, Engineering, Political Studies, Public Relations or other related disciplines and/or combination of relevant work experience
· Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite and in particular Excel
· Effective project management skills including: plans and organizes efficiently, coordinates multiple parties, schedules milestones, understands the review process, and respects deadlines
· Show a passion for Indigenous and community engagement
· Experience working with Saskatchewan’s Indigenous People and knowledge of First Nation and Metis issues in SK is an asset
· Proven verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills required for the creation of effective relationships considering the diversity and the geography and culture of northern Saskatchewan and that of all stakeholders
· Ability to work independently and collaboratively with a wide range of stakeholders on a diverse group of projects
· Demonstrated research and data analysis skills
· Open to learning and takes initiative
· Honest and ethical with the ability to work with confidential information
· Adapts and supports change positively and takes initiative
Work Location & Schedule:
· Saskatoon Corporate Office
· Occasional travel to Northern communities and Orano sites as required
The safety of our employees and candidates is a top priority at Orano. These changes if applicable will be discussed at the screening and interview stage.

Drug (including marijuana) and alcohol substance testing is a requirement for all Safety Sensitive positions. Applicants who have recently used marijuana recreationally may not pass a substance test as marijuana can remain in the user’s system for as many as 30 days after use.
Orano is an equal opportunity employer. We value the knowledge, experience and cultures and commit to the advancement of Indigenous Peoples, Women, Visible Minorities and People with Disabilities and strongly encourage all candidates from these designated groups to apply for our career opportunities.

Under the authority of the Nunavik director of Public Health and the coordination of the project manager for the Qanuippitaa? Inuit health surveys, the data analyst shall be responsible for survey-data analysis, data management, production of reports and formulation of recommendations after the data-gathering phase of Nunavik health surveys. He or she shall contribute throughout the processes of planning and conducting health surveys.

The analyst’s responsibilities shall include, in particular:

cooperating in the design and planning of health surveys (particularly by revising data-gathering tools and methodology);

developing, testing and optimizing data-analysis tools;

ensuring proper management of databases;

analyzing and interpreting the data in the context of realities in the field;

conducting specific analyses required by users;

contributing to the design of various monitoring aids;

formulating recommendations after analysis of survey data.

The data analyst for health surveys may also be required to work on other research issues.

Qualifications

Master’s degree in epidemiology or biostatistics; however, a combination of relevant training and experience may be considered

Experience in quantitative analysis and with data-analysis software

Familiarity with the various provincial, federal and Inuit health and social databases

Rigour and capacity for synthesis

Skills at maintaining ties with local, provincial and national partners

Awareness of the realities of Nunavik and Inuit culture shall be considered an asset

Excellent skills in at least two of the three languages in use in the region: Inuktitut, English and French

Capacity for teamwork

Familiarity with Voxco software shall be considered an asset

Familiarity with the MS Office 365 suite

Candidates who are beneficiaries of the James Bay and Northern Québec Agreement shall receive priority.

Conditions and benefits

Temporary, full-time (35 hours/week) position of two years with possibility of extension

Position based on telework

Salary according to the rules set forth by the MSSS ($25.25/h to $45.22/h)

Additional details
Interested candidates should send their résumé, in English and French, no later than November 18, 2020, at 5:00 p.m., care of:

Human Resources

Nunavik Regional Board of Health and Social Services

P.O. Box 900, Kuujjuaq, Québec J0M 1C0

ressources_humaines.reg17@ssss.gouv.qc.ca

JOB TITLE: Integration and Data Analyst
LOCATION: Winnipeg, MB
REPORTS TO: IT Manager, National Digital & Data Services

ABOUT PARIAN LOGISTICS
parian Logistics Inc, an affiliate of Stern Partners, owns a 28.6-acre property at 1530 Gamble Place in Winnipeg that houses the head offices and distribution centre for Warehouse One Clothing and Ricki’s Fashions, as well as the distribution centre for Bootlegger Clothing and cleo Fashions. Parian Logistics is also home of the newly created National Shared Services business unit that supports the Retailing portfolio of Stern Partner companies: Warehouse One, Urban Barn, Comark (Bootlegger, Ricki’s, and cleo), and Auld Phillips. The Shared Services include: Human Resources, Finance, Digital Marketing, and Information Technology.

THE ROLE
The National Digital & Data Services group plays a critical role for the IT business driven agenda in two key areas: 1) to effectively expand the business’ use of data as strategic enabler of corporate goals and 2) to provide an optimally integrated applications architecture that cost effectively enables business objectives. This team is a highly skilled and collaborative group of individuals who plan, coordinate, architect, and execute on all activities related to the integration and delivery of software programs, applications, and 3rd party solutions that enable business goals. This team also designs, develops, and implements data models for enterprise-level applications and systems.
The Integration and Data Analyst role is to plan, coordinate, and supervise all activities related to the integration of data across various sources into an organized and unified view. This individual is also responsible for the monitoring of data flow between databases, servers, and Cloud services to identify and implement the most suitable Data Integration architecture for the organization’s needs. Proven communication skills, problem-solving skills, and knowledge of integration best practices are critical to successful performance in this role.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Orchestrate integration projects and corresponding strategies between business areas and the Digital & Data team.
Plan, execute, and manage the strategic integration of new data and data stores into existing systems and infrastructure throughout the enterprise, including introduction of Cloud services as applicable.
Ensure that integration projects meet business requirements and goals, fulfil end-user requirements, and identify and resolve systems issues.
Ensure that integration planning and practices are aligned with strategic business goals and the company’s overall strategic vision.
Develop standards and processes to support and facilitate integration projects and initiatives.
Revise DI architectures when required to be compatible with changing business needs and client standards so that all legal, compliance, and operational requirements, such as data sovereignty, regulatory security and privacy policies, and service level agreements (SLA), are accounted for.
Maintain high standards of data quality through the introduction and enforcement of information handling processes and organization of the DI processes.
Conduct research on emerging DI products, languages, and standards in support of procurement, development, security, and integration efforts in relation to the Cloud, BI, and big data management.
Manage the selection, deployment, and maintenance of any DI tools (as-a-service (DIaaS) or DI On-premise) as deemed appropriate for the organization.
Ensure the collection and coherent interpretation of the various business processes affected by integration efforts.
Work diligently to enhance or improve business processes via integration, or, as necessary, minimize the impact of integration on those processes.
Evaluate results of integration projects, then report and make recommendations based on findings.
Frequently compare DI solutions with those available in the market to assess and monitor levels of service provided by current vendors.
Where applicable, investigate and qualify potential integration solutions in the Cloud, On-Premise, or in a Hybrid arrangement to better allocate resources.
KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS
Proven experience in overseeing the linking of cross-functional databases between disparate business units and systems.
Experience with business and technical requirements analysis, business process modeling/mapping and methodology development, and data mapping.
Extensive experience with data integration architectures, including hub-and-spoke pattern.
Technically fluent in programming languages and ETL tools, including SQL, SSIS, Python, and R.
Previous exposure to Cloud DI and management.
Strong background in risk management methodologies as they relate to integration and Cloud computing.
Direct, hands-on experience with automated DI tools.
Knowledge of relational database design and management techniques.
Good project management skills and/or substantial exposure to project-based work structures, project lifecycle models, etc.
Strong knowledge of system and software quality assurance best practices and methodologies.
Knowledge of network protocols and standards.
Strong understanding of end-user needs and requirements.
Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language.
Able to conduct research into application integration issues and products.
Highly self-motivated and directed, with keen attention to detail.
Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws
Ability to quickly attain excellent understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives.

EXPERIENCE
At least 3 years of related work experience in Data Integration at an enterprise level.
Four-year college diploma or university degree in computer science or computer engineering.

Exceptional detail-orientation.
Ability to read, review and analyze clinical trial documents, ideally familiarity with clinical trial documents, clinical study reports (CSRs).

Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills.
The drive to meet exacting deadlines and the flexibility to adapt to shifting priorities.
Ability to manage sensitive information with the utmost confidentiality.
Experience with Adobe PDF and MS Office products (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint) required.

ICH guidelines for clinical trial documents and EMA Policy 0070 are valuable assets.
Ability to understand and navigate MedDRA terms and their hierarchy.
Medical writing or trial data programming experience.
Working experience with SQL (MS SQL server), SAS, R, and statistical analysis of clinical or healthcare data would be a great asset, but are not a requirement.
Experience configuring and working with Natural Language Processing (NLP) tools would be a great asset, but are not a requirement for all positions.

We have more than 120 years experience of owning and operating assets with a focus on property, renewable energy, infrastructure and private equity. Our assets are held through a growing portfolio of private funds and public, listed entities. Brookfield is publicly listed on the NYSE, TSX and Euronext.

The Brookfield Private Equity Group (BPEG) operates and manages approximately $30 billion of assets through its listed entity (Brookfield Business Partners (BBU)) and private investment vehicles (Brookfield Capital Partners series of private funds). Our businesses operate within a number of industries including commercial and residential real estate services, road fuel distribution and marketing, construction services, energy exploration and production, oilfield and marine services, industrial manufacturing, metals and mining, water and wastewater services. Our operations are global, located in North and South America, Europe, Asia and Australia.

Role Summary

Reporting to the MD Business Operations, the Data Analyst, Business Operations is an active member of the Business Operations team, responsible for compiling and analyzing data to extract insights related to companies the broader team is evaluating for potential investments and provide support in identifying value creation opportunities at our existing portfolio businesses. The insights will be used to identify strategies related to revenue growth, cost optimization and capital decisions, etc. A combination of business understanding, technical skills and critical thinking will be required to extract actionable insights that can be used during investment due diligence and portfolio management.

This position represents an opportunity to play a key role in a growing Business Operations team with a focus on analysis, problem solving and opportunity ideations.

Critical to the success of this position is the ability to see an organization holistically while managing multiple, concurrent projects, and working collaboratively across the Business Operations team.

Primary Responsibilities

Support the due diligence process:
Works closely with end users (due diligence team) to mine, clean, massage and manipulate data from flat files, company databases and 3rd party sources to create analytics, develop insights and help identify opportunities and recommendations for key stakeholders
Develops and maintains data visualizations in various formats such as dashboards, reports, and presentations
Responds promptly and fully to requests related to ad hoc analyses, reports, and other management information services on a consultative basis
Develops business processes and systems for improvements in accuracy, efficacy, and efficiency
Assists with streamlining and automating processes, where applicable
Ensures compliance with all data management policy and procedure
Effectively manages projects and associated competing priorities, deliverables, and timelines
2. Support the Portfolio Management:
Mines, cleans, and manipulates data from monthly and quarterly internal update reports to BAM PE management from each business, creating analytics of actual results against annual and long-term business plans to identify improvement opportunities
Translates business requirements into data analytics requirements
Works closely with end users to determine requirements for data, reports, analysis, metadata, training, service levels, data quality and performance
Develops and maintains data visualizations in various formats such as dashboards, reports, and presentations
Performs descriptive statistics and analysis to develop insights and help solve business problems
Provides analysis, strategies, and recommendations for key stakeholders
Collaborates with cross-functional teams for improvements in accuracy, efficacy, and efficiency
Works with business operations leaders to collect information, analyze and prepare materials in support of the development and execution of exit strategies for each portfolio company either in the capital markets or through merger or sale transactions with strategic industry companies to realize optimum returns.
Candidate Profile

A professional, positive attitude and capable of contributing to a dynamic and team-oriented culture, the individual is financially astute, detail focused and demonstrates good business judgment. Self-motivated with a proven ability to perform in complex situations, cope with multiple and changing priorities and meet deadlines. Direct and insightful in approach, s/he possesses clear communication and interpersonal skills to quickly gain the respect and support from the Business Operations team.
Post-secondary degree in science, technology, engineering, math, economics, business, statistics or an equivalent field with a focus on business intelligence & analytics
Minimum of 3-5 years experience in data analytics/business intelligence
Advanced ability to use MSFT office tools, VBA knowledge and experience is helpful
Strong ability and hands on knowledge of writing SQL, as well as SQL query optimization experience
Strong ability in tabular reporting tools such as SSRS, Cognos, etc.
Strong technical and design skills with a BI dashboard tool: PowerBI preferred but Tableau and Cognos experience also applicable
Working knowledge of using SQL Server (SSIS, SSMS, SSRS, SSAS etc.) and/or Azure tools
Knowledge of statistical concepts in support of analysis and reporting.
Experience using statistical computer languages (Python, R, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers a plus: Google Analytics, Facebook Insights, Core metrics, AdWords, Crimson Hexagon, etc.
A curious analytical mind, strong attention to detail and quick learner
Comfort with ambiguity, strong problem-solving skills and intellectual curiosity to find hidden patterns in datasets
Structured thinker with the ability to rapidly drive to insights and implications
Our Culture

To be successful within the Brookfield organization, the individual must be committed to collaboration and teamwork. S/he shows personal initiative and strong work ethic at every turn and would be described by others as humble and low ego. This individual puts the needs of the organization, its people, and its investors ahead of his/her own and is driven by the opportunity to work with others to create long-term value.

The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
Are you a Machine Learning and Data Science expert? Are you passionate about statistics, fairness, and ensuring that the highest quality of work is achieved? This is an exciting time to join our team – we are changing the game in a big way!
If you are looking to join a company that offers unlimited opportunity, excellent leadership, world-class training and makes a big impact on the community – this is the role you’ve been waiting for!
The Data, Insights & Analytics team at Loblaw is hiring a Senior Data Scientist with experience in applied research and problem solving. The incumbent will be responsible for managing our Data Science Quality Assurance process, conducting detailed reviews of code and reports, crafting challenger models, and ensuring production readiness of our AI Solutions.
The successful candidate will have experience with developing and deploying production grade AI/ML solutions, have broad expertise in statistics, analytics, and ML, strong coding skill, and be an excellent communicator. The candidate will be responsible for ML Governance, QA process, and data science development best practices. You will work closely with senior leadership team to maintain a view of solution pipelines and readiness, coordinate with solution delivery on requirements, and ensure the highest level of performance, robustness, and fairness are met. The candidate will be required to communicate findings from the review, and work with the various data science teams to facilitate the operationalization of their work. The candidate will be a self-starter who has passion for providing various ways to improve effectiveness within the business.
What You'll Do:
Meet with various business units to understand their existing processes and identify opportunities for improvement
Lead the design and implement model validation framework for approving model and solution transition to production
Increase internal adoption of test design and best practices for machine learning and data science development
Coach, train and mentor junior team members and help build an inclusive team culture
Work effectively in cross-functional teams
You will ensure all projects are on track and provide the necessary updates to the management
Provide guidance for data and software development (SQL, Python, ML) approaches
Strictly adhere to legal and compliance guidelines; regarding access and exposure to sensitive and confidential information
What You'll Bring:
University, Master or Ph.D. degree in an analytical field of study (e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Industrial Psychology or other relevant fields).
5+ years of work experience directly related to quantitative analysis with proven results
Excellent working knowledge of across a broad set of data science skills, including traditional statistical methods, machine learning, Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision
Experience in SQL and Python
Experience working in cloud environments
Experience in analytical roles working with large data sets and analytic tools, and some subset of the following: scikit-learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch
Experience in software engineering is an asset
Critical thinking, problem-solving, storytelling skills
Ability to take initiative, multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
Capability to liaise with all levels across the enterprise on projects and ad-hoc requests
Strong detail orientation is essential in this role
A team player and self-starter
What You Can Expect:
We are a team of diverse and ambitious data professionals, who cultivate a friendly and inclusive work environment where you can be yourself. Our employees’ development is at the core of our business, offering endless possibilities for growth, learning and mobility. Let us help grow your skills through one of our many resources including the Loblaw Virtual Learning Centre, where you have access to hundreds of learning tools, or through casual coffee chats with our leaders who were once in your shoes.

JOB SUMMARY:

The Report Developer & Data Analyst uses technical and analytical expertise and proven knowledge of specialized reporting tools to gather, examine, interpret, evaluate and report on data stored in various database structures within the Law Society, including the Professional Regulation Division’s (PR) case management system (“IRIS”), and the Law Society’s membership database, the AS400. Evaluates reporting requirements to design reporting structures as required. Ensures the integrity of data maintained in IRIS. Recommends improvements to, or new requirements for, business processes, operational procedures and their corresponding structures. Provides and analyzes data in response to requests for information from the Executive Director of PR, Director of Case & Data Management (the Director), the PR Management team, other Law Society divisions, Benchers, Committees and Working Groups. The Report Developer & Data Analyst is the primary resource in PR for issues relating to data, statistics and reporting.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:
University degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Analysis or a related discipline, coupled with relevant, ongoing education in reporting, data analysis, statistical analysis, business intelligence, predictive analytics, database design and management.
Minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in the field of reporting and data analysis, plus 2 or more years of business analysis and project leadership experience using best practices and project management techniques to deliver value added solutions, in an AS400, DB2, and Microsoft environment.
Strong interpersonal skills related to needs identification, business process consultation, solution selling and relationship management at all levels of the organization to develop strong working relationships across departments in PR and across the Law Society, including IT.
Strong understanding of business unit processes, workflows and management control structures.
Strong understanding of performance measures, cost/benefit analysis and ROI.
Clear, concise and articulate communication skills to communicate business requirements, provide input into the design specifications of reporting and other technology solutions, communicate key insights from analysis, share professional knowledge and make recommendations.
Ability to gather, interpret and apply complex information.
Breadth of knowledge / experience with relational databases and data models, including modeling table relationships and writing and executing SQL queries to join, retrieve and analyze data from multiple database tables.
Breadth and depth of knowledge / experience in data analysis, business analysis and analytics.
Extensive knowledge and experience with report writing and technical requirements analysis, business process modeling/mapping, methodology development, and data modeling.
Breadth and depth of knowledge / experience with various forms of reporting, including the design and creation of ad-hoc reports, automated reports and interactive dashboards / UIs.
Extensive knowledge and experience with reporting data analytical and data mining tools, including Crystal
Reports, IBM reporting tools, Cognos Reporting tools and Cognos Framework Manager. Experience with SQL (IBM DB2, Microsoft SQL Server, etc.) including complex queries and stored procedures.

Client / Customer Service Delivery
In conjunction with the Director, the Team Manager & Sr. Java Programmer / Analyst (Team Manager) other Case & Data Management team members, the PR Management team and client department representatives, facilitates the identification of business and end-user report requirements, designs reporting tools to meet those requirements and ensures the accurate inclusion and maintenance of necessary data within IRIS.
Leads assigned projects with respect to business justification and reporting requirements.
Works with the Case & Data Management development team (development team) to ensure the integrity of the data in IRIS and that the reporting applications being developed meet business needs and standards of PR and are in accordance with industry best standards and specifications.
Provides support to the development team and business units throughout the life cycle of a project.
Oversees the basic reporting work and response to routine requests for statistical information delegated to and performed by the other Case & Data Management staff.
Performance Goals, Targets and Standards
Researches, quantifies and leads the development of business cases for cost-effective data management and reporting solutions in keeping with the defined and agreed needs of client departments and industry best practices.
Remains current on new products, trends and tools via technical journals, Internet sources, conferences and courses, and networks with other professionals.
Ensures awareness at all times of organization objectives with respect to current and projected plans for provision of reports to business users.
Prepares and delivers reports, recommendations, or alternatives for improving processes in reporting systems across the organization.
Advises the Director, Team Manager, PR Management team and management teams in other Law Society divisions who use IRIS regarding appropriate, effective, and efficient use of organizational reporting capabilities and functions.
Oversees the implementation of reporting structures in regards to technical changes and change management.
Develops routines and procedures for end-users to facilitate best practices, use of reporting tools and data analysis techniques.
Coordinates and performs in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new processes, and other post-implementation support.
Special Projects & Initiatives
Leads business unit resources assigned to data analysis and integrity, reporting projects under development, and provides consultation and project planning for the delivery of cost-effective, stable, predictable and responsive reporting functionality.
Researches, reviews, and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of existing report procedures and develops strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes.
Builds relationships with client department staff and managers, based on personal expertise and best practices with respect to reporting solutions to business process requirements.
Consults with business units regarding process and performance issues, gains consensus with respect to recommended solutions, and facilitates project planning, development and implementation.
Team Membership
Works closely with the Team Manager, other members of Case & Data Management, other PR departments, Information Technology (IT), departments in other Law Society divisions and external consultants in the identification, diagnosis, isolation and resolution of complex problems concerning the organization, management and reporting of data in IRIS.
Develops and shares expertise regarding Law Society business systems and regularly communicates with team members regarding reporting, projects and initiatives.
Leads and acts as a key contributor, chairing meetings, facilitating needs identification, and promoting the effective use of information technology solutions to business process and performance objectives.

Service Orientation

The requirement to maintain a high standard of commitment, ethics, respect, care in service delivery to clients (internal and/or external).

Communication and Interpersonal Skills

The requirement to structure and deliver effective verbal and written communication with clients, staff, licensees, the public, and others in a non-threatening and constructive way.

Team Orientation

The requirement to share responsibility for the achievement of team goals and the associated behaviours required for individuals to contribute effectively in a team environment.

Continuous Improvement

The requirement to demonstrate an attitude that consistently strives to improve a standard of excellence for one’s self and for the benefit of the organization, its licensees and stakeholders.

Problem Solving and Judgement

Description:
WHY WORK AT ROSS VIDEO?

We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results.

If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible.

If that resonates, and you’re someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we’d love to hear from you.

Data Analyst/Software Support - Manufacturing
Ross Video specializes in the design of products for the professional broadcast market. We design, manufacture and support a wide range of innovative products for use in broadcast, distribution, live event and production applications. Ross Video products have been sold into more than 100 countries. Visit www.rossvideo.com to learn more.

This position resides within the Manufacturing Process Development group. The group’s primary responsibility is to develop and maintain manufacturing processes required to reliably manufacture high performance electronic and mechanical systems, work with Product Development groups to introduce new products, support efficiency and quality initiatives. This position helps to create, support, and maintain online tools, database integration and software deployed within manufacturing. In this role you will be a key player interacting daily with our production departments, data systems manager, administrators and IS providing SQL database support.

What will you do…. provide computer support to shop floor personnel on production software systems. Create and modifying tables, reports, web pages and integration tools. Assist in software implementation, training and maintenance. Create web pages and dashboards using ASP, C# and SSRS with Visual Studio. Provide Data Analyst services to the Manufacturing group, including Industry 4.0 and BI initiatives. Create database tools to monitor and report quality and production related events using automation.

Do you have…post-secondary education in computer or electronics technology experience with SQL Server 2012 SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services). Experienced in ERP or MES systems within a manufacturing environment

Are you… Able to work independently or as part of a team, detail-oriented and work logically following procedures, with a solid aptitude for learning

IN A NUTSHELL

Do you have integrity, commitment, and a drive to get results? Then Ross is the place for you, and we'd like to hear from you.
Position: Manufacturing Data Analyst & Software Support (Job Req # 2020-191)

Description:
Job Title:
System Analyst - Operational Technology (ID# 64-2020)
Who We Are:
Impala Canada is the only Canadian pure play palladium producer. Located in Northern Ontario, Lac des Iles Mine (LDI) features a world-class orebody consisting of an open pit and one of the largest underground mines in Canada. Mine operations are data driven, supported by the latest in mine technology and equipment, real-time mine management and automation. At LDI we employ over 580 of Canada’s best and brightest in their field. Driven to exceed, our people are motivated by a culture of safety in a positive and collaborative work environment. With a modern infrastructure, significant exploration portfolio and dedicated employees, Impala Canada is a well-positioned, low cost, long term, sustainable palladium producer.
Job Description:
As Lac des Iles continues invest in advanced operational technology, we are looking to expand our technical team and continuously improve our data management and analytics capabilities. This is a salaried position requiring a four days on three days off work schedule at the Lac des Iles mine site 90km north of Thunder Bay. Any candidates with an interest and required skills are encouraged to apply.

Responsibilities:
Design, implement and support data acquisition systems, including real-time sensor historians and web-based business intelligence solutions.
Integrate and maintain multiple software platforms used to collect, aggregate and report business metrics using custom dashboards and reports.
Collaborate with the operational team to continually improve data-led decision making for production, quality and reliability.
Create and evaluate innovative ideas and technologies to help improve the way we do business.
Support the operational technology team in the maintenance of software and hardware infrastructure, including servers, switches, routers, firewalls and backup solutions.
Qualifications:
Bachelor degree or technical diploma in computer engineering, computer science or related field.
Strong understanding of, and experience with, business intelligence software and concepts, including the capture, extraction, analysis and reporting of data using a variety of tools such as SSRS, Power BI and Microsoft Excel.
Hands-on experience building analytical capabilities with software and IOT solutions including, SQL, Python, Pi, Windows Server, Hyper-V and Linux, or equivalent tools.
Ability to plan, organize and problem solve in complex and fast-paced environments.
Results oriented, resourceful, team player, with a mature and positive attitude.
Well-developed communicator with ability to articulate challenges and opportunities to non-technical personnel.
What's in it for You:
The position offers a competitive remuneration package consisting of base salary, health & medical insurance, retirement savings plan and travel allowance. Accommodations and meals are provided while at the mine site. On your off duty time enjoy various outdoor and indoor extracurricular activities.

Please note, that all job offers are conditional upon successful completion of a pre-employment medical which includes drug and alcohol testing.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please visit www.nap.com for more information regarding Lac des Iles Mines Ltd. Visit careers.nap.com to apply

Contract, Toronto ON

This role will support the data management needs for the Come to Work and Accessible Technology programs in the GTA region. The role will also involve connecting with participants to conduct surveys and collect service quality information.

Your impact at CNIB
Support the development of program advertisements, curriculum for program delivery, training manuals, and Program Participation reports
Organize collected resources and track issues to resolution
Schedule meetings, coordinate events/training
Research and ensure data elements completeness for program participants
Requirements

Who you are
A customer service oriented individual with strong interpersonal skills
Results oriented, flexible, with a professional attitude
Amenable to changing deadlines, with excellent administrative, time management, and organizational skills
We want to hear from you if you:
Are between 15 and 30 years of age at the start of employment
Have a valid Social Insurance Number at the start of employment and are legally eligible to work in Canada
Are a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or person to whom refugee protection has been conferred
Have advanced computer skills with proficiency in MS Office software, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Knowledge of Salesforce is an asset
Personal or professional experience relating to blindness and sight loss is considered an asset
Personal or professional experience working with assistive technology and/or accessible environments is considered an asset
Benefits

CNIB is committed to creating and fostering an inclusive culture and welcomes applications from diverse candidates, including but not limited to Indigenous peoples, women, candidates with disabilities, and candidates of colour. We strongly encourage applications from applicants with sight loss. Direct lived experience would be a definite asset. We're excited to review your application!

Please note: while we invite applications from all interested and qualified applicants, we are unable to follow-up with every applicant.

Closing date: August 4, 2020

We are a global IT and business consulting services leader, and after 40 years, we're still growing! Join Canada's largest IT Company in our Global Wealth and Banking Services Division in Toronto.?

CGI supports our members career aspirations, offering learning initiatives and provides access to our global health and wellness program. We also offer competitive compensation and benefits such as our share purchase plan, a profit sharing program, flexible schedules that guarantee a good work-life balance!

Innovation, technology and service delivery are our focus. Our goal is to ensure our clients remain ahead of the competition. We provide a full spectrum of services from Business Consulting and Systems Integration to Managed Services and IP Solutions that are transforming our clients operations and helping them to succeed.?

Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Your future duties and responsibilities

• Collaborate with Product Owners and other Analysts to understand business requirements and define technical solutions.

• Demonstrates good understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle.

•Troubleshoot production support issues post - deployment and come up with solutions as required.

Required qualifications to be successful in this role

• Minimum 3 years+ experience in Data Analytics, preferably within financial and banking.

• Education: College/Bachelor in Information Technology/Computer Science. Recent training or certifications in relevant discipline preferred.

• Strong SQL, Hive/Beeline skills preferred.

• Previous experience of working in an Agile Development environment.

• Ability to Work well in a challenging environment.

• Previous experience of working in an Agile Development environment.

• Ability to Work well in a challenging environment.

• Strong troubleshooting skills

• Excellent writing skills, oral communication skills, Strong process skills, and leadership ability.

The Capgemini Freelancer Gateway is enabled by a cutting-edge software platform that leads the contingent labor world for technology innovation. The software platform leverages Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to make sure the right people end up in the right job.

A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50 year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of over 200,000 team members in more than 40 countries. Initiative is different to other media agencies.

We are not trapped by a legacy structure primarily centered on paid advertising. Instead, we are liberated by a new world structure designed to deliver highly differentiated and highly effective communications strategies for our clients.

We’re not the biggest agency in town. So rather than outsize our competitors we must outsmart them. That’s why we’ve built the strongest strategic capability of any agency in the market. Core to this strategic capability is an obsession with culture and how brands can pivot from brand advertising (which is forgettable) to cultural branding (which is memorable).

Our new world model is comprised of four central “craft centers” – Client Advice and Management, Strategy, Communications Design and Partnerships.

OUR BEHAVIORS

Initiative respects that everyone has something unique to contribute to the agency.

We are a bunch of eclectic and brilliant misfits with diverse backgrounds that represent the unique fabric of consumers and culture.

We want you to be yourself. We want to hear your opinions. We want to see your passion and energy.

If you disagree with something you see or hear then speak up. We will never punish or penalize you for bringing something important to our attention.

If you believe you can improve something in the agency then speak up. We will always listen to your ideas and suggestions.

We will not tolerate harassment, bullying or corporate politics. We will not tolerate discrimination of any kind. We expect you to be responsible on social media and remember that you represent the agency and should not bring us into disrepute.

We are committed to your learning and development. The agency will organize regular training to enhance and accelerate your career – we expect you to prioritize training and actively participate.

We strive for world-class work on every client, every time.

We believe that good enough is not good enough.

We are currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to join our growing Analytics team in Toronto. Analytics is the core of all decision-making at Initiative and as our newest Analyst, you’ll provide campaign intelligence to drive real business outcomes. We are looking for an analytical thinker with a love for using their technical knowledge to solve business problems and is experienced with KPI tracking/ reporting and data visualization techniques.

Position Summary:

The role of a Data Analyst is to provide business portfolio and digital media intelligence to make faster and more effective investment decisions to drive business outcomes.

Responsibilities:
Extract, review and prepare data on media campaign effectiveness to create regular client reports in Excel and Tableau, assisting in solving complex client problems
Design and build data visualizations and dashboards for the purposes of monitoring, understanding and optimizing media performance
Perform proactive and reactive analyses to ensure data integrity
Work closely with Business Intelligence team to continue to automate processes and ensure database architecture is adequate for growing client needs
Analyze data to recommend campaign execution and visualization improvements, based on data and observed trends
Use strong analytical skills, business acumen and attention to quality to provide data and analysis to assist in solving complex problems
Communicate insights and suggest improvements based on data and observed trends
Drive core insights from data to suggest, create and execute multivariate or a/b tests that drive fundamental improvements
Collaborate with Audience & Platforms team in developing advanced tagging strategies for measuring attribution and capturing multi-channel campaign performance across social, mobile, programmatic, managed service digital media, and e-commerce
Develop and present standard and ad-hoc reports and analysis to stakeholders across the organization
Work closely with Business Intelligence, to ensure timely and accurate maintenance of internal dashboards and data management
Perform proactive and reactive analyses to ensure data integrity
Create performance forecasts and track actual performance against forecasted plans


Qualifications:
BS/BA in Statistics, Economics, Math, Computer Science, Marketing or applicable experience
1-2 years of experience in an analytics based role
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Excel, SQL, or VBA
Knowledge of various measurement technologies: website traffic analytics software (tagging and log file based) such as Omniture (SiteCatalyst), Google Analytics, WebTrends, comScore, MOAT/ IAS, and social media analytics (Facebook Insights, Sysomos)
Experience working with MediaOcean Prisma and third-party ad-serving platforms (Sizmek/Campaign Manager)
Strong familiarity with using Tableau, Google Data Studio, DOMO or other reporting visualization platforms
Topline knowledge of social media marketing and programmatic buying
Strong problem solving, business analysis, and quantitative skills
Strong communication skills (verbal & written); ability to provide concise, clear reporting and actionable analysis
Ability to pull data from multiple sources and formulate comprehensive and actionable reports
Proven ability to self-check work to ensure results are error-free
Ability to plan, organize and work on multiple tasks simultaneously
Knowledge/ Familiarity of coding languages such as R, Phyton
Keenness to learn new platforms and technology

Job Description

Assist in identifying and documenting current state data environment and Identity & Access Management (IAM) business, process, and application architectures

Work with business to identify business rules per CDE and transform those rules into data quality rules used for data quality profiling

Create and/or update existing Data Policies and Standards

Requirements


Minimum of five (5) years of experience as a data analyst planning, designing and implementing data initiatives in a data management, data governance, data quality, and/or metadata capacity.

Experience in creating an enterprise-wide business glossary comprised of candidate and/or approved business terms and definitions
Experience in creating data lineage (both technical and business) and in depth analysis of data sources to verify conformity to Business Rules and Data Quality standards.

Demonstrated knowledge of Data Management and Data Governance experience.
