REPORTING TO: Manager, Member Services
DEPARTMENT: Membership
LOCATION: Toronto / Montreal / Vancouver
LANGUAGE: Bilingual preferred (English and French)

OUR COMPANIES STORY
SOCAN is Canada’s largest member-based rights management organization. We serve and champion more than160,000 music creators, publishers and visual artists, advocate for them, and protect their rights. We do this by using and building state-of-the art technology that ensures they are paid for their work – music and art we all enjoy.

OUR PEOPLE
▪ We’re a team dedicated to supporting the national and global music ecosystem with innovation,
commitment and desire in an ever-changing music and business landscape.
▪ We love music and believe that music creators and publishers provide a truly priceless and essential
aspect of national pride and culture.
▪ We’re immensely proud of our workplace culture and this attribute permeates our works.
▪ Our team proudly supports and gives back to our communities and causes, raising tens of thousands
of dollars for important charitable organizations and initiatives.

WHO YOU ARE?
The Data Analyst will be Membership’s data-to-business translator, responsible for providing insights, analysis and visualisations that will help drive the success of our department. We are looking for a collaborative, forward thinking individual who will understand both Membership’s data and reporting needs and strategic objectives, and how to marry the two. This role will require a driven candidate who can work with a great deal of autonomy and who has a keen ability to present their analysis and insights
Your responsibilities will include:

Data Research and Analytics
▪ Develop and build reporting capabilities to aid in day-to-day operations of department
▪ Quick turnaround of ad hoc requests and provide support when business queries are made
▪ Initiate and identify continuous improvement activities by analyzing department KPIs, and member
service trends and feedback
▪ Use data to help identify and build requirements and business cases for recommended changes
▪ Work with leadership team to plan, design and conduct post contact surveys
▪ Connects a variety of business data from different data sources and analyzes data to gain insights
Data Visualization
▪ Visualize, identify and analyse complex data into compelling dashboards to track department KPI’s
▪ Consolidate visualisations and analysis into presentations to management and stakeholders
▪ Aggregate and analyze feedback and data across all available channels (pendo, post contact, five9,
case management etc.) at every touch point of the member journey
▪ Updates KPI dashboards on a regular basis to outline major changes, and changes to the system that
have impact to KPI's

Stakeholder support:
▪ Builds relationships with key business users and decision makers to understand their business analytics
needs
▪ Develops, fosters and maintains effective working relationships with internal and external
stakeholders
▪ Work closely with each division within Membership to determine business reporting needs and gaps
▪ Liaise with Data Governance Office and IT regarding data access/systems, data models, methods, best
practices and any issues
▪ Other duties as required

SKILLS
▪ Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant
amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
▪ Excellent organizational and time management skills
▪ Problem solving skills
▪ Strong interpersonal skills
▪ Writing and Presentation skills
▪ Skilled user of Business Intelligence tools, such as PowerBI; Experience with programming language
such as SQL and DAX preferred
▪ Intermediate to advanced experience with Excel

EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE
▪ Bachelor of Science in Math, Statistics, or Computer Science or equivalent
▪ At minimum 5 years of relevant working experience

ATTRIBUTES
• Analytical
• Strong Communicator
• Detail Oriented
• Methodical
• Curious
• Capable of spotting patterns

PERKS OF THE JOB

As an employee of SOCAN, you will be eligible to receive the following benefits and perks, to help make your-day-to-day life a little bit easier:

▪ Comprehensive benefits plan (medical, vision, dental)
▪ Access to online medical service to receive professional advice and prescriptions if needed
▪ Defined Contribution Pension Plan, with employer matching
▪ Flexible spending account allowance that can be used towards medical or wellness related costs
▪ Competitive bonus

▪ Group discounts on car / home insurance
▪ Employee Family Assistance program

SOCAN’s is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that supports a diverse workforce. All
qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, gender,gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability and age.

ACCESSIBILITY

Should you require accommodations please contact us directly at hr@socan.com and we will make the necessary accommodations. Applications submitted to this email address will not be accepted.

Description
Job Summary:
As an Information Systems Process and Data Analyst, you are responsible for the design, implementation, and support of service management demand and request processes, tools and data frameworks. You enable collaboration and will work with various business leaders, the Business Relationship Manager (BRM) and other Information Technology teams to ensure the Ledcor IS team processes are tuned for velocity using the underlying ServiceNow platform, and present leadership with data-driven perspectives on performance, gaps and projections. You think ahead and look at the big picture in order to make Ledcor a stronger organization.

Come join our team in Vancouver or Edmonton today!
Essential Responsibilities
Contribute and execute a data management strategy to support our various LIS leaders, managers and teams
Identify and prioritize service areas and portfolios to develop baselines, KPI metrics and reporting
Monitors and coordinates improvements for the request and fulfillment processes
Test and iterate both business request processes and internal IS to ensure fluid and efficient processes
Contributes service descriptions and service-level agreements (SLAs) for specific services to the organization’s service catalog
Perform continual maturity assessments on service delivery processes and outline improvement opportunities or reduction of “waste” processes that will assist in improving velocity
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Business or Management Information Systems
Minimum 5+ years experience in a role of similar capacity or as a business analyst
3+ years of ServiceNow experience or equivalent ITSM service platform
Experience in design and implementation of service workflows
4 years Experience in data analysis, data structuring and visualization.
Experience implementing, tracking, analyzing and improving operational metrics associated with velocity, quality and customer satisfaction
Demonstrated ability and knowledge of interpreting business goals and strategy to derive innovative technology solutions and automation opportunities
Solid understanding of ITIL methodology and agile frameworks
Solid knowledge of the design of service workflows, ITBM modules, Service/Project Portfolio and Service Catalog
Intermediate skills Outlook, Word & Excel, PowerPoint and Visio
Advanced skills in Word & Excel to create and update templates, reports
Solid knowledge of ServiceNow and underlying capabilities
Additional Information:
Company Description
The Ledcor Group of Companies is one of North America’s most diversified construction companies. Ledcor is a company built on a rich history of long-standing project successes.
But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!

At Golder, we thrive on challenges.

Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?

Golder Associates is seeking a dynamic Junior Engineer/Scientist working to assist on air quality and greenhouse gas related projects as part of the Atmospheric Services Team in the Vancouver office.
The successful candidate will be involved in a broad range of responsibilities, that could include:
Assisting with air quality assessments, as part of a larger group and consists of: emission inventory development, data analysis, calculations, atmospheric dispersion modelling and reporting
Field work including source identification, data collection, ambient air quality, meteorological and noise monitoring, (instrument set up, calibration, data acquisition and analysis)
Meteorological model preparation and dispersion modelling
Assisting on multi-disciplinary projects with data analysis and reporting
Greenhouse gas quantification and management
Climate change assessments
Sustainability related projects

Strong interpersonal skills, and excellent communication skills written and verbal

Well-developed computer skills

Location: Quebec City, CanadaDans des marchés en rapide évolution, les clients travers le monde font confiance Thales. Thales est une entreprise où les personnes les plus brillantes du monde entier se regroupent pour mettre en commun leurs idées et ainsi s'inspirer mutuellement. Dans tous les secteurs où œuvre Thales, notamment laérospatiale, le transport, la défense, la sécurité et l'espace, nos équipes darchitectes conçoivent des solutions innovantes qui rendent demain possible dès aujourdhui.TRT-Canada est reconnu pour être un véritable pôle dinnovation technologique qui façonne loffre de Thales aussi bien au Canada que sur les marchés de l'exportation. Le rôle de Thales Recherche et Technologie (TRT) est d'étendre l'influence de Thales au sein des communautés scientifiques et techniques, proposant une plate-forme pour l'innovation et le partage des connaissances tout en attirant de talentueux diplômés en sciences qui viendront parfaire son expertise.In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.TRT-Canada is recognized as a multi-technology innovation house that shapes Thales offering in Canada and on export markets. The role of Thales Research and Technology (TRT) is to extend the influence of Thales within the scientific and technical communities, offering a platform for innovation and knowledge sharing, and attracting talented science graduates to build on our acquired expertise.

RAISON DÊTRE:

Les chercheurs sont principalement impliqués dans la planification, la conduite et l'analyse d'expériences, pour une utilisation finale définie (développer de nouveaux produits, procédés ou applications commerciales) ou pour élargir la connaissance scientifique en général. Bien que la recherche soit souvent effectuée sur une base individuelle, le chargé de recherche et technologie travaille généralement au sein d'une équipe plus large et une partie de son travail consiste organiser des rencontres périodiques de suivis afin dinformer le gestionnaire R&T ainsi que la direction technique.

MISSIONS PRINCIPALES:
Effectuer des travaux en laboratoire ou sur le terrain pour soutenir une étude / expérimentation
Traiter et analyser des données et des résultats
Se tenir au courant des développements scientifiques et techniques pertinents en vue dorchestrer une feuille de route
Contribuer la visibilité de la R&T en participant la publication darticles scientifiques et techniques, la création d'affiches, la présentation des travaux de recherche lors de conférences (invité), ou la soumission de propositions d'idées ou projets (concours)
Soutenir une proposition et cahier des charges;
Soutenir le démarrage de projet, et jalons (Revue Technique, Transfer Technologique);
Identifier de nouvelles propositions de recherche incluant des collaborations avec les écosystèmes académiques et industriels
Participer des évaluations par les pairs (peer-review) de travaux scientifiques
La gestion administrative de projet, des contrats liés aux projets, du co-financement, de la protection intellectuelle, au financement Institutionnel, Gouvernemental, ainsi que les crédits la recherche
La rédaction des minutes meeting reliés lavancement des projets
Participer aux activités de recrutement de personnel ou de subvention
Agir en tant que Conseiller Technique lors de jury, rencontre, événement, atelier de travail, et développement des affaires
Contribuer un atelier / groupe de travail
Veiller ce que les normes de qualité soient respectées
Développer des solutions originales aux problèmes
Rencontres de projets avec le client: démontrer / expliquer les résultats de la R&T aux parties prenantes
Supervision : en collaboration avec le product owner, suivre lexécution des tâches de recherche (sprint planning, task breakdown, backlog), évaluation technologique (spike, whitepaper), ou personnel qui développe la technologie (sprint review, retrospective)
Supervision de technicien, stagiaire, junior, apprenti, professionnel de recherche ainsi que chargé de technologie dans lexécution de leur mission de recherche
Conception de solutions logicielles ou systèmes dans le but de résoudre un verrou scientifique, technique ou opérationnel
EXIGENCES TECHNIQUES ET REQUIS :
Maîtrise / Doctorat en génie industriel, en génie logiciel, en informatique ou en mathématique. Un baccalauréat dans une autre discipline de lingénierie ou en informatique combiné avec de lexpérience complémentaire est également acceptable
3-5 années dexpérience
Connaissance des logiciels Primavera P6 et Microsoft Project
Connaissance approfondie de la programmation par contrainte (langage MiniZinc, solver Chuffed)
Connaissance approfondie du mixed-integer linear programming (modèles programmés en C++ et python, solver CPLEX et/ou GUROBI)
Connaissances des techniques de serial schedule generation schemes, large neighbourhood search, et méthodes de matheuristics
Connaissance des problèmes de type « Resource Constrained Project Scheduling Problem » (RCPSP)
Connaissance des processus décisionnel Markov, hierarchical MDP, agent-based modeling
Connaissance en allocation de ressource (optimisation combinatoire), systèmes daide la décision, et programmation linéaire et quadratique
Atouts: apprentissage par renforcement et algorithmes génétiques
Bonne maîtrise du français parlé et écrit; la maitrise de langlais est un atout mais non une exigence.
Atout : être éligible lobtention dune cote de fiabilité ou de sécurité exigées par les contrats du gouvernement fédéral
Avoir de la curiosité intellectuelle, le gout dapprendre et de se diversifier est essentiel
Avoir des aptitudes pour le travail en équipe et favoriser lintelligence collective
Un sens aigu de la qualité et des bonnes pratiques
Job Purpose:

Research Scientists are primarily involved in planning, conducting and analyzing experiments, either with a definite end use (to develop new products, processes or commercial applications) or to broaden scientific understanding in general. Although research is often carried out on an individual basis, Research and Technology Lead usually work as part of a larger team and part of the job is to organize periodic follow-up meetings in order to inform the R&T manager as well as the technical direction.

Key Job Functions:
Project meetings with the client: demonstrate / explain R&T results to stakeholders
Supervision: in collaboration with the product owner, follow the execution of research tasks (sprint planning, task breakdown, backlog), technological assessment (spike, whitepaper), or personnel who develop the technology (sprint review, retrospective)
Supervision of technician, intern, junior, apprentice, research professional as well as technology lead in the execution of their research mission
Design of software solutions or systems in order to resolve a scientific, technical or operational issue
Carry out laboratory or in the field work to support a study / experiment
Process and analyze data and results
Keep abreast of relevant scientific and technical developments in order to lead a roadmap
Contribute to R&T visibility by participating in the publication of scientific and technical papers, the creation of posters, the presentation of research work at conferences (guest), or the submission of ideas or projects proposals (competition)
Support proposal and statement of work
Support project kick-off, and milestones (Technical Review, Technology Transfer)
Identify new research proposals including collaborations with academic and industrial ecosystems
Participate in peer-review of scientific work
Management of project, contracts linked to projects, co-financing, intellectual property, Institutional and Governmental funding, as well as research credits
Drafting of meeting minutes related to the progress of projects
Participate in recruitment activities - staff or grants
Act as Technical Advisor during jury, meeting, event, workshop, and business development
Contribute to a workshop / working group
Ensure that quality standards are met
Develop original solutions to problems
Key Skill Requirements:
Masters / Doctorate degree in computer engineering, software engineering, computer science or mathematics. A bachelors degree in other engineering discipline or computer science combined with a complementary experience is also acceptable
3-5 years of experiences
Knowledge of Primavera P6 and Microsoft Project software
In-depth knowledge of constraint programming (MiniZinc language, Chuffed solver)
In-depth knowledge of mixed-integer linear programming (models programmed in C ++ and python, CPLEX solver and / or GUROBI)
Knowledge of serial schedule generation schemes, large neighborhood search techniques, and matheuristics methods
Knowledge of Resource Constrained Project Scheduling Problem (RCPSP) type problems
Knowledge of Markov decision making, hierarchical MDP, agent-based modeling
Knowledge of resource allocation (combinatorial optimization), decision support systems, and linear and quadratic programming
Asset: reinforcement learning and genetic algorithms
Fluent in French spoken and written; fluency in English is an asset but not a requirement
Asset: be eligible for a reliability or security clearance required by federal government contracts
Intellectual curiosity, the desire to learn and to diversify is essential
Have skills for teamwork and foster collective intelligence
A keen sense of quality and good practices

Your Opportunity
We are looking to recruit an Apprentice Data Analyst to join our Trust team. You will produce accessible data insights for a wide range of audiences, up to and including Executive and Trust level, using specialist analytical tools. The successful candidate will be based in the GLF Head Office in Banstead. Upon successful completion of the apprenticeship you will be recognised for entry onto the Register of IT Technicians confirming SFIA level 3 professional competence and those completing the apprenticeship are eligible to apply for registration. A creative thinker
Logical in your approach

SLR is a leading global consulting firm. Our teams provide consulting and advisory services to various sectors including oil & gas, industry, built environment, federal government, mining & minerals, power, and infrastructure.

Why join SLR?

SLR provides a healthy and dynamic work environment, challenging career opportunities and competitive compensation and benefit packages. Our "One Team" culture is the foundation on which our company is built. If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunities for personal and professional growth, come shape your ambitions with SLR.

Job Description
We have an exciting opportunity for Junior Environmental Engineer or Scientist in our Kamloops, BC office to assist our current teams with site assessment and remediation projects across the province of BC. The proposed role within our business would be someone who could both perform field programs as a field supervisor, collecting environmental data to support PSI, DSI, and Remediation programs, as well as coordinating and managing basic field programs, remediation programs, and general due diligence works. The role would also include the completion of environmental inspections / monitoring of construction projects for various clients and contractors throughout BC. Technical report writing and client interaction expected.
Key Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Participating in all facets of contaminated sites projects including preliminary and detailed site investigations and remediation projects. Includes project coordination, field sampling, and reporting assistance.
Conducting field programs involving sampling and monitoring of soil, groundwater, vapour and remediation system operation and maintenance while adhering to health and safety standards.
Assisting in the preparation of a variety of environmental summary reports.
Assisting other disciplines (i.e. hydrogeology, air quality, permitting and ecology) as needed.
Assisting with the operation and maintenance of in-situ remediation systems including data collection, performance monitoring, influent/effluent sampling, and associated technical summary reporting.
Preparation of environmental management or protection plans for civil construction projects, as well as completion of environmental inspections of construction projects to verify compliance with environmental management or protection plans.
Technical Skills / Abilities / Experience:
Minimum 1 year of experience in contaminated site assessment and remediation field programs preferred (e.g. soil, groundwater, and vapour sampling).
Experience with various remedial techniques (i.e. excavation, biological treatment, in situ treatment, risk assessment co-op and internship experience recognized) including mechanical troubleshooting and process performance monitoring/evaluation.
Understanding of regulatory requirements for site assessment and remediation in British Columbia.
Experience with Construction Environmental Management / Protection Plans and inspection (environmental monitoring) events.
Knowledge and practical application of health & safety requirements unique to subsurface investigations and contaminated sites.
Work well independently including ability to work alone in remote locations and adapt to conditions/resources following the guidance of more experienced personnel.
Work well as an important part of a project team.
Solid written and verbal communication skills, with demonstrated skill in technical report writing.
Education / Qualifications / Memberships:
Degree or Technical Diploma in environmental science, engineering or related studies.
Professional status or eligibility for professional status with a professional organization (A.Sc.T, E.I.T, G.I.T., or P.Eng., P.Geo preferred).
Personal Attributes:
Willingness and ability to travel.
Strong communication skills and attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to work with others, supervise and direct employees and contractors.
Aptitude to document excellent field notes and follow direction of others.
Commitment to technical excellence, client care and safe work practices.
Valid driver's license and access to a vehicle for field use.

The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.

Why is this role important?

Are you a Machine Learning and Data Science expert? Are you passionate about statistics, fairness, and ensuring that the highest quality of work is achieved? Bring your expertise and knowledge to Canada’s largest retailer. We are looking for smart, nice and curious team members to help bring our Data, Insights & Analytics game to the next level. This is an exciting time to join our team – we are changing the game in a big way!

If you are looking to join a company that offers unlimited opportunity, excellent leadership, world-class training and makes a big impact on the community – this is the role you’ve been waiting for!

The Data, Insights & Analytics team at Loblaw is hiring a Senior Data Scientist with experience in applied research and problem solving. The incumbent will be responsible for managing our Data Science Quality Assurance process, conducting detailed reviews of code and reports, crafting challenger models, and ensuring production readiness of our AI Solutions.

The successful candidate will have experience with developing and deploying production grade AI/ML solutions, have broad expertise in statistics, analytics, and ML, strong coding skill, and be an excellent communicator. The candidate will be responsible for ML Governance, QA process, and data science development best practices. You will work closely with senior leadership team to maintain a view of solution pipelines and readiness, coordinate with solution delivery on requirements, and ensure the highest level of performance, robustness, and fairness are met. The candidate will be required to communicate findings from the review, and work with the various data science teams to facilitate the operationalization of their work. The candidate will be a self-starter who has passion for providing various ways to improve effectiveness within the business.

What You'll Do:
Meet with various business units to understand their existing processes and identify opportunities for improvement
Lead the design and implement model validation framework for approving model and solution transition to production
Increase internal adoption of test design and best practices for machine learning and data science development
Coach, train and mentor junior team members and help build an inclusive team culture
Work effectively in cross-functional teams
You will ensure all projects are on track and provide the necessary updates to the management
Provide guidance for data and software development (SQL, Python, ML) approaches
Strictly adhere to legal and compliance guidelines; regarding access and exposure to sensitive and confidential information
What You'll Bring:
University, Master or Ph.D. degree in an analytical field of study (e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Industrial Psychology or other relevant fields).
5+ years of work experience directly related to quantitative analysis with proven results
Excellent working knowledge of across a broad set of data science skills, including traditional statistical methods, machine learning, Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision
Experience in SQL and Python
Experience working in cloud environments
Experience in analytical roles working with large data sets and analytic tools, and some subset of the following: scikit-learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch
Experience in software engineering is an asset
Critical thinking, problem-solving, storytelling skills
Ability to take initiative, multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
Capability to liaise with all levels across the enterprise on projects and ad-hoc requests
Strong detail orientation is essential in this role
A team player and self-starter
What You Can Expect:

We are a team of diverse and ambitious data professionals, who cultivate a friendly and inclusive work environment where you can be yourself. Our employees’ development is at the core of our business, offering endless possibilities for growth, learning and mobility. Let us help grow your skills through one of our many resources including the Loblaw Virtual Learning Centre, where you have access to hundreds of learning tools, or through casual coffee chats with our leaders who were once in your shoes.

Other perks of joining Loblaw:
Competitive compensation and benefits package
Office with incredible amenities including an on-site gym, volleyball court and basketball court (turned ice rink in the winter!)
A flexible work environment which values balance

Pension Plan

Advanced Analyst

The EA Marketing Analytics team is looking for an analytics professional to take on the role of Advanced Analyst at our Vancouver studio. At EA, an Advanced Analyst is a Manager-level team contributor, and we are looking for someone who can take our analytics to a new level by digging into diverse data sets relating to our marketing campaigns, applying leading edge data analytics techniques, conducting experiments, extracting insights, creating evocative data visualizations and communicating recommendations to our marketing partners in ways that create clarity and influence the business.

Ideal candidate:


In addition to an ability to build statistical models that turn numbers into knowledge, we are looking for strategic business acumen and the ability to build relationships across a global network of technical, marketing, and communications teams. You need to be able to use data to become a trusted advisor to our marketing partners, allowing us to reach new heights in our player acquisition, engagement, and monetization programs. If you can combine this with a pioneering spirit, commitment to team success, and a passion for the video game industry, this might be the right job for you.

What you will do:
Work with marketing partners to understand their problems, identify those that can be best solved with data, prioritize opportunities based on impact, and provide analysis in ways that will lead to action.
Select and analyze an array of internal and third-party data sources to find the marketing signal in the noise.
Develop and evangelize methods and models for understanding how marketing channels can expand player awareness, interest, acquisition, monetization, while improving existing analytical methodologies and processes.
Analyze the return on marketing strategies, campaigns and other programs and make recommendations according to your findings.
Design crisp data visualizations and presentations to tell compelling data stories to partners and influence the business.
Produce and maintain interactive dashboards and other automated reporting to inform the business.
While not a management role, you will provide leadership, expertise, guidance and mentorship to others in the Marketing Analytics team on a daily basis.
Skills and knowledge expected:


Combination of ability and passion for using data to improve the business.
Approach analyses with structured, strategic thinking to develop a plan before digging into data.
Strong collaboration skills that allow you to excel in matrix team environments.
Skill in applying quantitative methodologies such as correlation analysis, regression modeling, cluster analysis, factor analysis to provide marketing insights.
Apply analytical thinking to organize and interpret data from marketing channels such as online video, social media, websites, email, and online ad platforms.
Programmatically collect, organize, analyze data from web APIs.
Data visualization skills that reveal the meaning in the data using tools like Tableau, R Shiny, Data Studio, Power BI, Looker.
Powerful enthusiasm for continuous learning, improvement, and sharing.
Background and technical skills:


University degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Quantitative Marketing or equivalent.
5 years relevant hands-on analytical experience, preferably in video-gaming, technology, digital marketing or media.
Proficiency in R statistical programming (or equivalent) to explore diverse data sets and create descriptive and predictive models.
SQL skills including experience querying datasets from multiple sources.

About Brookfield
Brookfield Asset Management Inc. is a global alternative asset manager with over $500 billion in assets under management. We have more than 120 years’ experience of owning and operating assets with a focus on property, renewable energy, infrastructure and private equity. Our assets are held through a growing portfolio of private funds and public, listed entities. Brookfield is publicly listed on the NYSE, TSX and Euronext.
The Brookfield Private Equity Group (BPEG) operates and manages approximately $30 billion of assets through its listed entity (Brookfield Business Partners (“BBU”)) and private investment vehicles (Brookfield Capital Partners series of private funds). Our businesses operate within a number of industries including commercial and residential real estate services, road fuel distribution and marketing, construction services, energy exploration and production, oilfield and marine services, industrial manufacturing, metals and mining, water and wastewater services. Our operations are global, located in North and South America, Europe, Asia and Australia.
Role Summary
Reporting to the MD Business Operations, the Data Analyst, Business Operations is an active member of the Business Operations team, responsible for compiling and analyzing data to extract insights related to companies the broader team is evaluating for potential investments and provide support in identifying value creation opportunities at our existing portfolio businesses. The insights will be used to identify strategies related to revenue growth, cost optimization and capital decisions, etc. A combination of business understanding, technical skills and critical thinking will be required to extract actionable insights that can be used during investment due diligence and portfolio management.
This position represents an opportunity to play a key role in a growing Business Operations team with a focus on analysis, problem solving and opportunity ideations.
Critical to the success of this position is the ability to see an organization holistically while managing multiple, concurrent projects, and working collaboratively across the Business Operations team.
Primary Responsibilities
Support the due diligence process:
Works closely with end users (due diligence team) to mine, clean, massage and manipulate data from flat files, company databases and 3rd party sources to create analytics, develop insights and help identify opportunities and recommendations for key stakeholders
Develops and maintains data visualizations in various formats such as dashboards, reports, and presentations
Responds promptly and fully to requests related to ad hoc analyses, reports, and other management information services on a consultative basis
Develops business processes and systems for improvements in accuracy, efficacy, and efficiency
Assists with streamlining and automating processes, where applicable
Ensures compliance with all data management policy and procedure
Effectively manages projects and associated competing priorities, deliverables, and timelines

2. Support the Portfolio Management:
Mines, cleans, and manipulates data from monthly and quarterly internal update reports to BAM PE management from each business, creating analytics of actual results against annual and long-term business plans to identify improvement opportunities
Translates business requirements into data analytics requirements
Works closely with end users to determine requirements for data, reports, analysis, metadata, training, service levels, data quality and performance
Develops and maintains data visualizations in various formats such as dashboards, reports, and presentations
Performs descriptive statistics and analysis to develop insights and help solve business problems
Provides analysis, strategies, and recommendations for key stakeholders
Collaborates with cross-functional teams for improvements in accuracy, efficacy, and efficiency
Works with business operations leaders to collect information, analyze and prepare materials in support of the development and execution of exit strategies for each portfolio company either in the capital markets or through merger or sale transactions with strategic industry companies to realize optimum returns.

Candidate Profile
A professional, positive attitude and capable of contributing to a dynamic and team-oriented culture, the individual is financially astute, detail focused and demonstrates good business judgment. Self-motivated with a proven ability to perform in complex situations, cope with multiple and changing priorities and meet deadlines. Direct and insightful in approach, s/he possesses clear communication and interpersonal skills to quickly gain the respect and support from the Business Operations team.
